result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus P. Stage

records.addlTxt: Jury status hearing on November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:37 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Marcus P. Stage appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Marcus P. Stage.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Key is heard on the status of the cases. Requests another status with a possible plea and sentencing.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:47 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Marcus P. Stage appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Marcus P. Stage.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Key is heard on the status of the case.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:50 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Marcus P. Stage appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Marcus P. Stage.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF99 and 22CM21 called 

Atty Key is heard. 

22CF99 - Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Atty Key is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will plea not guilty as to each count, clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 

22CM21 to be scheduled for a JSH.
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:16 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Marcus P. Stage in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Marcus P. Stage.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CM21 and 22CF99 called together

22CF99 - Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
22CM21 - Adjourn to track along with defendants other case. 
Atty Key is heard and requests that both cases are continued to another date.
22CF99 - Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:45 am.
22CM21 - JSH hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Post-judgment hearing on July 19, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Jury status hearing on July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Request by Atty Key's Office to reschedule the 6/30/22 jury status hearing due to a scheduling conflict.  No objection by DA Steiner.  JA approved and rescheduled to 7/7/22 at 9:00 AM by Zoom.

2:12 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Marcus P. Stage in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Marcus P. Stage.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Atty. enters not guilty plea for def.
     Clerk directed to enter plea.  Court sets June 30 for status hrg.
     Court concludes at 2:14 p.m.
Jury status hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Retainer - Atty Daniel M Key

Adjustment Number: 22A 000663,
Payable Number: 70612,
Receipt Number: 22R 001180,
Amount: $20.00

1:44 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Marcus P. Stage in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:51 AM Defendant Marcus P. Stage in court, in person.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court finds probable cause.
     D.A. requests $150 cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages; Defendant is to submit to random PBTs at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.   No violent or abusive contact with D.A. 
     Court explains conditions to Def.  Def. believes he can follow the conditions.  Court advises of right to an atty.
     Court concludes at 10:57 a.m.
Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages; Defendant is to submit to random PBTs at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.   No violent or abusive contact with D.A.
